comment: Online, her class was straightforward. Everything is based on a textbook, but it's online so you don't need to purchase it. Easy A, but she's NOT accessible. She messed up a quiz and the whole class emailed her, separately, and she took weeks to get back to us to open another one. Grades hard on discussions... I got an A, but what a lazy teacher.
She was very absent minded, never responded to any of my questions, has a weird schedule, yea I didn't enjoy her class at all. It was easy though, so o well.

She requires all discussions to be replied to with even longer responses. Every discussion you post must have a source, her discussions alone brought my grade down 2 letter points. If this is not a requirement, dont take it. She offers a nice extra credit opportunity near the end of the semester but it's still not even worth it.

I would not take this professor ever again. She doesn't explain criteria and then grades very harshly, or she takes off points after you actually did something. She deletes discussions when she grades them so you can't check back on them. She doesn't teach, it's essentially reading a boring book and getting bad grades on quizzes on it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took her for an online class in gender and popular culture, which I thought would be an interesting class for my last semester of college. She was very unprepared for this course and was failing people WHO WERE ON THE DEANS LIST. She does not seem to care about the success of her students at all. I don't really have anything positive to say.

Easily one of the worst profs I've had at KSU, which is really not good. She is very difficult to reach by email in a very content heavy course. She probably said 4 things to help direct our class throughout the semester which is just sad and lazy. The content is interesting but the literature she uses is hard to follow. Huge research project to do
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Tough grader, didnt like any of my discussion posts which I worked hard on. These lowered my grade a lot. Does not accept any late work no matter what.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: This professor was by far the toughest professor I have ever had. The class had discussions, quizzes, and a final. The quizzes were easy, but were not worth much towards your grade. Then, the discussions were graded way too tough. She took off points if you cited a quote that someone else had also quoted and if you had grammar issues. didn't learn

I took her for an online course. It was mostly quizzing that is based on the powerpoints available in class. Easy to pass if you are able to commit. We rarely had discussion posts, so it was easy to forget to reply to others. Extra credit paper available at the end of the term, so that's nice as well.

For an online gen-ed class, it was a little bit more difficult that what I was used to. Her quiz questions are specific but all the information can be found in the book or in her lecture notes. She grades discussion posts pretty intensely so you need to give effort. One huge extra credit opportunity. It's not impossible, just challenging.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class consistis of quizzes, disscussions and a final. All quizzes you can use the text book to find the answers but all of the questions are too confusing and philosophical for a sex class All discussions are graded pretty toughly and you need to read over the syllabus a couple times to actually know what you need to do. I didnt learn anything
